item.description:
So some of you here may remember the Conspiracy Cafe. It was a huge amount of work and not enough of people helped or showed up. So Waldo and I have come up with the idea of holding the "Conspiracy Cafe" or whatever we decide to call it here at MIT during the swapfest. We would be sure to have some interesting conversations and possibly make some really good contacts. Anyone interested in showing up or helping? If we dont get any people here that show any interest or encouragement we may not do it so speak up!
Here are the details from the MIT web site:

MIT SWAPFEST
http://events.mit.edu...

Time: 9:00aâ€“2:00p

Location: N4, Albany St Garage and Lot

MIT's monthly high-tech, computer, electronics and ham radio flea market. Buy, sell or swap all things nerdly.

Held the third Sunday of each month, April through October. Rain or shine covered space is available for all sellers.

In the Albany St. Garage and adjacent lot, on Albany St. between Mass. Ave. and Main St., Cambridge.

Sellers, call 617-253-3776 (9-5) for more information.
Web site: http://www.swapfest.u...
Open to: the general public
Cost: $5, $4 with MIT or Harvard ID
Tickets: At the gate
This event occurs on the 3rd Sunday of every month through October 19, 2008.
Sponsor(s): Radio Society W1MX, MIT, UHF Repeater Assn. W1XM, MIT, MITERS
For more information, contact:
Nick
617-253-3776
w1mx-officers@mit.edu

Web site: http://www.swapfest.u...

Open to: the general public

Cost: $5, $4 with MIT Harvard ID

Tickets: At the Gate

This event occurs on the 3rd Sunday of every month through October 18, 2009.

Sponsor(s): UHF Repeater Assn. W1XM, MIT, Electronic Research Society, MIT, MIT Radio Society, Harvard Wireless Club

For more information, contact:
Mitchell Berger
617-253-3776
w1mx-officers@mit.edu
item.how_to_find_us: please contact me if you can help in any way with this possible event.

group.name: We Are Change Boston / Boston 9/11 Truth

item.name: 5/17 MIT swapfest flea market. Oportunity to get a 9/11 truth table and network
